p: The S protein is a glycosylated protein that is responsible for homotrimeric spikes on the surface of the viral particle and mediates viral entry into host ( Bosch et al., 2003). S protein exists as two subunits (S1 and S2) on the viral particle due to cleavage of S protein by host furin‚Äêlike proteases during viral replication ( Bosch et al., 2003; Izaguirre, 2019). The N protein binds with the viral RNA and is involved in packaging of viral RNA into the viral particle during viral assembly ( Chang et al., 2006; Hurst et al., 2009). The M protein is one of the most important proteins in the virion structure. It is present in higher quantities than any other protein in the viral particle, while E protein is found in small quantities within the virion ( Nal et al., 2005).
